website_summaries.verdict: Nice price point for a bunk ladder that has multiple attachment options.
pros: Can attach the bunk ladder in a few different ways to give you a high level of flexibility, depending on the hardware you have available
Includes rubber tread step covers that will protect against slipping
Ladder has a convenient height of 60-inches, but you can trim it as needed
cons: May not provide enough support for people carrying heavy items

customer_reviews.title: Got the wrong size but made it work
customer_reviews.text: I should have measured - it was too long but after I cut 6” off the bottom of the legs with a hack saw it works perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Becca

customer_reviews.title: LOVED IT
customer_reviews.text: This ladder was a God send for my predicament. I was on the top bunk but the ladder that came with the bunk bed hurt my feet. I used this ladder and NO MORE FOOT PROBLEMS. (I wear a size 6.5 shoe and about 115 lbs. I had no problem going up or down the steps.) I didn't even fully attach the ladder. I only hooked the hooks onto the existing frame right over the existing bunk bed steps. (I didn't use the screws/bolts) If you have kids or live in a dorm GET THIS ASAP.
customer_reviews.author: Bubblegum Pink

customer_reviews.title: Works but is definitely lightweight
customer_reviews.text: It works as intended however it is lightweight tubing so you have to ensure that the angle is steep or it will bend and break. The installation instructions explain how to ensure you have the proper angle for this exact reason. For the price it is as good as one could expect and suits my needs fine, thus 4 stars. I cut about 8” off the end of the feet to fit the cab-over bunk height in our class-c motorhome and that was easy enough with my grinder and a cut-off wheel. If you don’t have that tool you’ll need a metal hack-saw or possibly a dremell with a cutting wheel would also work.
customer_reviews.author: AJ Sr

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Nice ladder, well built. If you need to cut it down to fit, you must remove the rubber feet and cut from the bottom. The top has threaded inserts inside the tube that are needed to fasten the ladder. It did not appear that the inserts were easily removable. No problem, just be aware of it. It also was supplied with several different types of fittings to secure the top. Overall, very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Aerobat

customer_reviews.title: Customizable for crafty people
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this ladder. Our bunk is about 10" shorter than the intended height. Fully accepting that I was voiding any warranty, I used a reciprocating saw and bi-metal blade to cut the 10" off the bottom. Then I popped the rubber feet off the old section, and capped the bottom where I cut instead. Cuts must be made from the bottom, because cutting the top will remove the threaded holes where the hooks attach. Ladder seems well built, and was exactly as described. With some modifications, it worked perfectly for us.
customer_reviews.author: Topher

customer_reviews.title: The ladder came as described and on time.
customer_reviews.text: The ladder was very sturdy for the application. I was able to easily shorten the ladder to the proper length, however I would have preferred to shorten from the top. Due to the way the top brackets were installed in the tubes, the only way to shorten the ladder was from the bottom. I really liked the brackets that mounted to the bunk, they hold the ladder secure and they will keep the bunk from getting scratched.
customer_reviews.author: Lowell Suderman

customer_reviews.title: Mounted installation seems dangerous
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2014 Thor Four Winds 31L Class C Motorhome. This ladder is light weight and easily portable, but the way it seats in the mounts is worrisome. Additionally, the typical RV plywood it's screwed into the side of is not a very strong mounting solution. I'll have to figure out something better and possibly modify it myself, but with this seemingly common setup it would have been nice if that was accounted for in the product and something better for mounting would have come with it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Casey

customer_reviews.title: Great for light weights
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a 2018 Jayco trailer. It is a bit long for our set up so we aren’t able to secure it in place on the bunk. Easily able to hold the weight of our 60 lb child, who is the main user of the ladder. Not sure I, as an average size adult woman, would personally try to use it as my main source of ladder.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Lauf

customer_reviews.title: Good for the camper
customer_reviews.text: Been using this in our camper for 2 years to get to the bed over the cab. It's very solid, especially when you use the receivers to hook the ladder in for stability. One of the hooks on the top of the ladder won't stay tight no matter how tight I screw it in. Holds 225 pound people no problem.
customer_reviews.author: wildcat

customer_reviews.title: awesome
customer_reviews.text: great ladder! our wooden one (Southbeach) snapped within a couple months. looked for a metal ladder and couldnt really find one that "hooks". this one hooks onto the bunk bed, is long enough but not overly long, and holds my 6yo (70lbs) if he needs to get to his little brother) very sturdy but also super lightweight so i can stick the ladder on the top bunk during the day that way my 1yo doesnt climb up there. 100% recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda cohen

customer_reviews.title: Using this a a bunk bed ladder
customer_reviews.text: Got a triple bunk bed for the kiddos and it did not come with a ladder so I ordered this one. Metal because I was worried they'd break a wood one. This one is sturdy, easy to adjust, already assembled just needed to loosen 2 screws to turn the hooks, rubber foot grips on the rungs makes it easier for little feet. So far so good just wish the hooks could be adjusted further but no biggie. I would buy this again if a new bunk came without a ladder
customer_reviews.author: LBRose

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Ladder. Lots of Kid Traffic.
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy ladder that looks great in our Winnebago Minnie bunkhouse camper. Followed the instructions to make the necessary (for us) cut-down adjustments for exact fitment. No problem. The instructions to complete the adjustments were straight forward and thus the result was a perfect fitting ladder. Our 4yo goes up and down this ladder with no trouble. The ladder stays in place very well. The ladder fits on the bunks or in storage when not in use. We love this ladder.
customer_reviews.author: JET

customer_reviews.title: Good addition to Class C bunk bed
customer_reviews.text: Light and study when attached to the bunk bed with the included metal "U" shaped peg. I had to saw off about 7 inches off the bottom for it to fit our Class C RV bunk bed. And still looks good. There is a slight indentation on the ladder - but not enough to make it unusable - that likely happened somewhere along the delivery chain. The box came somewhat shredded on one corner but did its job of protecting the goods inside. Happy with the ladder.
customer_reviews.author: Jon R

customer_reviews.title: Great for the RV with some modification
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this ladder to use in our RV for the top bunk. Based on other reviews, we ordered a pipe cutter along with it. We have a forest river surveyor 247bdhs and took about 4 inches off of the bottom of the ladder to make it the right size. I used it last night to check out a wall on the top and it seemed sturdy and worked well for me, so should work great for the kids!
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase. Just what I needed for the RV.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this ladder for the bunk bed in our RV. I had to trim about 5 inches off the bottom to maintain the recommended safety angle per the instructions. It appears well built and it is easy to trim and install.
customer_reviews.author: Merlin Nilrem

customer_reviews.title: Great product but ours was USED!
customer_reviews.text: We just received our ladder, the box was extremely worn with a large amount of tape on the ends. Still trying to be optimistic, we opened it to find that that the ladder appears to have been used and the hardware was previously installed as well. The only reason it didn't get 5 stars is because of the condition of the product. We ordered new and this was NOT new. But this appears to be a great product -- sturdy, lightweight and it looks good too.
customer_reviews.author: WT

customer_reviews.title: Works great for the RV after cutting the legs to the right length.
customer_reviews.text: Works like a champ. Cut the legs with a hacksaw so the ladder fits in the brackets and is at the right angle. I’m 250lbs and I have gone up and down a couple times so I know it hold but I don’t intend to use it for me normally. I’m definitely at the max capacity for this ladder so I will be very careful when I’m on it. Perfect for kids and smaller adults to get up in the top RV bunk.
customer_reviews.author: J. Christensen

customer_reviews.title: Ladder is universal and may need to be retro fit...read the instructions!
customer_reviews.text: Like many of the reviews I read prior to purchasing this ladder it may need to be cut to fit your specific unit. Upon reading the directions enclosed in unit, it appears that the ladder is universal and gives instructions as to how ladder should fit, end result of it doesn’t fit out of box, you will have to measure and cut.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Strong ladder
customer_reviews.text: This ladder is just what I needed for access to the top bunk in my rv. I followed the instructions and measured and cut what was recommended and it fits perfectly. I see many years of use from this ladder it is very sturdy when cut to properly fit. Cutting wasn’t hard it is aluminum construction. It should hold the beautiful finish for a long time. Would definitely buy again. Great price as well.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Stanley

customer_reviews.title: Works for our RV
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our the bunk beds in our camper. Like the other reviews, it was a little long and we had to cut off the legs a couple inches to make it fit but after doing so, it works great. Easy for the kids to use and waited too long to get a ladder. Wish I bought this sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer H.

customer_reviews.title: Poorly Designed mounting brackets are a safety hazard
customer_reviews.text: The press in "nuts" on this ladder are a joke at best that hold the retaining brackets on the top. They will not stay tight and cause constant issues. The remainder of the ladder is identical to the quality of the back ladders on most RV's to get on the roof, so keep that in mind if you trust it to its rated 250 lb capacity.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for bunkhouse travel trailer
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful ladder for our double bunk camper trailer. We had to cut it down so that it wasn't sticking out in the aisle way to the bathroom. It was an easy fix. We adjusted the height and then put the rubber caps back on the end. Heavy duty, sturdy, and has great workmanship. I expected this ladder to last a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Schaw

customer_reviews.title: Perfect ladder for our camper
customer_reviews.text: This product was perfect for our camper we will be using it in our bunk beds it is very sturdy was easy to cut down to make a perfect height for our camper and is very durable I would recommend it and would purchase it again we are very pleased with this product
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Eakin

customer_reviews.title: This way a very easy and cheap solution and we are very pleased
customer_reviews.text: Don't understand why our travel trailer didn't come with a ladder to begin with considering my kids were falling off the top bunk trying to get out. This way a very easy and cheap solution and we are very pleased. Easy to remove and store. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon shopper

customer_reviews.title: Light weight but sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: We bought for our three year old to climb in and out of his bunk in our camper - it is light weight and easy to install the brackets. I am happy with the sleek look and it is easy to tuck up out of sight when not in use. Overall this product was perfect for what we were looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna N.

customer_reviews.title: This model does NOT have angled steps.
customer_reviews.text: The first question answer is "This is designed for a RV bunk bed situation. The steps are angled so when the ladder is at an angle the steps are level. " This is not true as the steps are angled for a straight up and down installation. I've missed the return window due to holiday so will have to find another use for it.
customer_reviews.author: JSand

customer_reviews.title: Gets my kids from the floor to a higher position
customer_reviews.text: Worked well in our camper. Followed the advice of a Pinterest poster and secured it to the top bunk with some air duct strapping. Works great! Wouldn't try climbing up it myself, but will work good for the kiddos.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon and MelisaTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: We only needed 56" so we used a hacksaw to cut the bottom of the ladder then replaced the rubber stoppers and it works great. It hooks on the curve just fine
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this for our RV for a curved upper bunk. We only needed 56" so we used a hacksaw to cut the bottom of the ladder then replaced the rubber stoppers and it works great. It hooks on the curve just fine. It is exactly what we needed to help kids get to the top bunk without climbing on the bottom bunk or having to keep a step stool in the way.
customer_reviews.author: AG'sMom

customer_reviews.title: Sharp Edges
customer_reviews.text: This ladder works great and was very easy to cut down to size but no matter what we do we can't get the top piece to stay put so it doesn't scratch my daughter every time she comes down the ladder. I might have to wrap the top in bubble wrap which won't look great but I suppose will fix the scratching problem.
customer_reviews.author: PortCityMama

customer_reviews.title: Review from the least finicky person
customer_reviews.text: DON’T WASTE YOUR MONEY !! I specifically purchased it because it stated it was sturdy. Quite the opposite. The frame is flimsy meaning it has the sturdiness of aluminum foil. Anything over 20lbs ((YES pounds) will bend it.
customer_reviews.author: Karina

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use in closets that have high shelves I can't reach without a ladder. This ladder is very lightweight so I can move it easily where I need it. It is compact so it fits in the closet without taking up a lot of room. I did not install the hook hardware but I did wrap the top of the rails to keep from scratching the surface it leans against.
customer_reviews.author: tanyaj

customer_reviews.title: Worked for what we needed.
customer_reviews.text: Great for kids and smaller teens. Feels a little sketchy if you weigh more than 150. But it suited our needs. It’s also easy to cut and adjust for the correct height needed.
customer_reviews.author: S. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. Added to the side of our daughters loft bed for easier ladder access. Definitely sturdy for kids or adults. We're 160-240lbs, held us just fine, better than our step stool! Looks good too
customer_reviews.author: Bobzero101

customer_reviews.title: Worked for my daughter's loft bed
customer_reviews.text: We bought this as a replacement ladder for my daughter's loft bed, but we had to use heavy duty zip-strips to secure it because the top hooks didn't do the job. Still it works and my daughter loves how the ladder is slip proof.
customer_reviews.author: K. Reazin

customer_reviews.title: Great RV ladder
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect ladder for the RV. I bought the 60", cut it to fit my application (which I anticipated), and functions perfectly. Light weight, and stows easily.
customer_reviews.author: Mr ATC

customer_reviews.title: Light and conveniet
customer_reviews.text: My bunkhouse travel trailer came with a heavy steel ladder. I replaced it with this lightweight aluminum ladder that is much easier to stow on a bunk during the day. I did have to cut about 2 inches off the bottom to fit it to the top bunk better. I don't know if it would be sturdy enough for a heavy adult but we just use it for grandkids.
customer_reviews.author: David White

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: Had to cut to fit height for overhead front bunk in our class C motor home, which was relatively easy. Read directions on angle measurements, to make sure weight load is correct. Very happy with this ladder, perfect for our needs.
customer_reviews.author: Joanie P Terciak

customer_reviews.title: Great Bunk Ladder for Travel Trailer
customer_reviews.text: This is a great quality ladder that works great for the bunks in my travel trailer. I am always confused about why trailer manufacturers do not just provide a bunk ladder out of the factory, but I digress. I did have to cut the ladder to size, but this was not difficult nor time-consuming to do. I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Seth Ronning

customer_reviews.title: Great for our purpose
customer_reviews.text: It is lightweight, easy for a child to pick up, I wouldn’t feel comfortable as a Heavier adult climbing on it, its just sturdy enough for me to feel okay climbing it slowly.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Great for College Loft!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my daughter to use with her lofted bed in her college dorm. It is very light and sturdy. It's easy to move with one hand and doesn't take up much space. This is a much easier way to get into a loft than using the ends of the bed as a ladder and she really loves it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Gadgets

customer_reviews.title: Stromberg-Carlson LA-460 Bunk Ladder
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Follow directions for distance to balance out weight of climbing up this ladder. Then cut off to hook to area you desire. Feel like all the weight is on the ladder and will work well for us and not harming the padding on the front of the bunks that are definitely not strong enough for pulling on and climbing.
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: This works great. It has supported people weighing upwards of 300 ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband made a lofted bed from pallets and we needed a way to get people up to the bed. This works great. It has supported people weighing upwards of 300 lbs with no problems. Easy to use and can be moved whenever necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Camper bunk ladder
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed for the top camper bunk. A little light weight, but made sure I was no more than 12” from the base. Should be strong enough for the kids.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Lilla

customer_reviews.title: Company Responsive to questions.
customer_reviews.text: Well built. I had a question, Called Stromberg. Very friendly and helpful.
customer_reviews.author: N. Fritz

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Works well in the camper bunkhouse. Had to trim a few inches off, but that was easy to do, and the rubber feet protect the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Decarlo

customer_reviews.title: May need minor length adjustment . Needs to fit vertical. Also question weight rattings
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice works good for children. Had to shorten 2 inches at Bottom for my trailer application . Happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: don

customer_reviews.title: Great for RV’s!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our 27’ bunkhouse camp trailer for the top bunk. We had to cut about 6” off of it to make it fit, but it was easy to do and worked perfectly for us! After cutting the ends for the perfect fit, we put the rubber pads back on easily. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs J Cargill

customer_reviews.title: This works!
customer_reviews.text: We have a Bullet bunkhouse travel trailer. This ladder makes getting into the top bunk easy enough for this old lady to even manage it with ease. The grandkids love it. We cut it down to size giving the correct angle as suggested in the instructions. We're using the hooks to attach it to the bunk. They seem to old it securely. This makes it easy to move when it's not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Kate R.

customer_reviews.title: sturdy and works
customer_reviews.text: Light weight, sturdy and works. Rungs can be rough on feet.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Had to cut 5” off to fit my class C ...
customer_reviews.text: Had to cut 5” off to fit my class C overhead cab bunk. Really takes about 10 minutes to put up with most of that being measuring and remeasuring to make sure it is at the 11-12” distance and centered. Cheap hacksaw, tape measure, and cordless drill to screw in brackets is all that is needed.
customer_reviews.author: Crafty5

customer_reviews.title: Forget it....
customer_reviews.text: When using the slider and an angle, as it was intended by the attachments, the rungs on it are not level/flat like they should be.
customer_reviews.author: MMC70

customer_reviews.title: Problem solved!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered our camper, and it was delivered without a bunk ladder. This fit perfectly! Sturdy enough to handle our rowdy climbers!
customer_reviews.author: Cindybob

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed . . .
customer_reviews.text: My crawlspace is nearly 5 feet deep at the access hatch in the floor. This worked out perfectly for getting in and out of the space from above. Used a tubing cutter to shorten it 3 inches and am in business. Thx!
customer_reviews.author: J. Edd Burns

customer_reviews.title: Strong
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy. I have no worries letting the kids climb these. They're very easy to cut to modify their length as needed. Absolutely would buy again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon_Customer

customer_reviews.title: Needed adjustment
customer_reviews.text: After cutting it a bit on the bottom these fit very well and serve the purpose. Happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: JRM

customer_reviews.title: Worked great in our RV and it was simple to cut ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked great in our RV and it was simple to cut the legs off to the right size using a pipe cutter tool (not included, but we had one). I like how the mounts can be screwed into the side of the bed frame instead of having to hang the ladder over the (very thin) piece of wood.
customer_reviews.author: Michael C

customer_reviews.title: Hard to find but worth the search!
customer_reviews.text: We used the ladder for a bunk bed. The ladder is trim, unobtrusive and sturdy. It is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Medwadowski

customer_reviews.title: Great Ladder!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this great ladder to use in my store and lean it on high shelves in order to obtain items in areas where a conventional ladder won't fit. I've found it to be very strong and sturdy, and the rubber feet keep it stable on the floor. I highly recommend it to anyone needing such an item.
customer_reviews.author: Gretchen Miller

customer_reviews.title: We purchased the 5 foot ladder because the bunk was not placed up that high and it worked great, plus we have room to spare in c
customer_reviews.text: Fit dorm bunk perfectly. We purchased the 5 foot ladder because the bunk was not placed up that high and it worked great, plus we have room to spare in case they want to raise it higher. You need to use a philips screw driver to adjust the metal overhangs.
customer_reviews.author: Boo this Boo that

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great, remove bottom rubber and cut to length and then replace rubber. Makes getting in the bunks easy for the kids
customer_reviews.author: jerry johnson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, lightweight but strong. The plastic bars feel good on the feet. The chrome looks nice. I bought this to replace a broken ladder for my son’s bunk bed.
customer_reviews.author: JLS

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect small enough for don't take up the room modern room at worse wonderful
customer_reviews.author: Chris Larose

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for getting my 7-year-old up and down from the top bunk of the rv!
customer_reviews.author: LD

customer_reviews.title: Nice ladder
customer_reviews.text: Perfect replacement for my Class C over the cab bunk. Had to be cut to size
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Battaglia

customer_reviews.title: Nice 👍🏻
customer_reviews.text: Pretty easy to install have to do a little cutting to fit the height.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Good for children
customer_reviews.text: Just tested it out. Great for my five-year-old, but a little unsure about average-sized adults using it. Works great for our tiny space and easy to move out of the way when needed!
customer_reviews.author: Rebekah in TX

customer_reviews.title: Good Choice
customer_reviews.text: We replaced our RV ladder with this one. We made a good choice.
customer_reviews.author: C. Hastings

customer_reviews.title: ladder for my travel trailer
customer_reviews.text: lightweight and doesn't feel very sturdy but does it's job. mainly for my kids to use so not sure how adult/heavy person use would work out over time. good grippy rubber covers for each rung. easy to cut to size with a pipe cutter.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis H

customer_reviews.title: Took a long time to ship
customer_reviews.text: Ladder is good quality. Three star rating due to long shipping times.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: 60 inch bunk Ladder
customer_reviews.text: lightweight but very sturdy and was able to shorten to use in my RV
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not the greatest
customer_reviews.text: For $60 I expected more. Ladder works if trimmed to the proper length,however it's not very well constructed and the rubber step covers slip right off.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy ladder
customer_reviews.text: This ladder will work well in our fifth wheel for the bunks. It's a little tall but can be cut down. Seems to be well made, we are very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Friesen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: A great addition to our RV. Very sturdy for the kids.
customer_reviews.author: Jason B.

customer_reviews.title: Great little ladder for bunk beds
customer_reviews.text: Great little ladder for bunk beds. not for large adults. It is sturdy, but could break with a large man.
customer_reviews.author: Fernanda Mitten

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy enough for lightweight kids. Questionable for heavy adults.
customer_reviews.text: Seeing how adults would be using this ladder, I did not think it would hold up in the long run.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Over-Priced
customer_reviews.text: This is a very cheap item, its overpriced. It wobbles a bit, and is not as solid as it appears. I would buy this for 20.00. But I'm keeping it, because I don't want to hassle with it anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Edith

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Was to long for the RV, but hubby cut some off and my grandkids loved it.
customer_reviews.author: ag

customer_reviews.title: Great ladder for our RV bunks
customer_reviews.text: Great ladder for our RV bunks. We cut down to size which was easy. We did not fasten down, we need to store it while not in use. Sturdy and light
customer_reviews.author: Earl Clark

customer_reviews.title: Not as sturdy as hoped for.
customer_reviews.text: Isnt as sturdy as hoped for. But it holds my 8 yr old fine for now.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Quilty

customer_reviews.title: this is a well constructied ladder, perfect for our camper's bunkbeds.
customer_reviews.text: The product appears to be well made and very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas A. Baumgarten

customer_reviews.title: Great construction, just wish they would offer them in ...
customer_reviews.text: This appears to be the shortest we could get, but to meet the 11 degree pitch requirement I had to cut 6" off the legs. Great construction, just wish they would offer them in 54" instead of 60".
customer_reviews.author: BPPilot

customer_reviews.title: Makes for Easy Access
customer_reviews.text: This ladder worked out prefect for accessing the upper bunk in our RV
customer_reviews.author: Celtic Chick

customer_reviews.title: Have 4 lively great grandchildren that use this continually when we take them ...
customer_reviews.text: Have 4 lively great grandchildren that use this continually when we take them in the camper. Holds up well - easy to move and put back on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stromberg Carlson 60 Inch LA-460 Bunk Ladder-60
customer_reviews.text: Works great to get kids in the top bunk of our Jayco RV. Sturdy, and not unbearable on bare feet. Good quality!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Missing pieces.
customer_reviews.text: I knew, per the description ,that the box had been opened prior to shipping. No problem. Upon arrival and opening we discovered that it was missing a bracket and a screw. Not a big problem for us as my husband can cobble most things together, but in this case, there were missing pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Sylvester

customer_reviews.title: Awesome. If I knew now though
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. If I knew now though, I would maybe cover part that hangs on the wood with some fabric or something. Kids will just climb and move it and yank of it, etc without realizing they are ruining the wood on the bed itself. But the ladder is sturdy and great looking
customer_reviews.author: CorrienteLatina, LLC

customer_reviews.title: Easy to move & store
customer_reviews.text: Although I didn’t like the color it works great. Used it for a pair of loft beds that has ladders on the sides that can’t be accessed because they are side to side along a wall. Easy to move around so it’s not in the way and the flat steps don’t hurt your feet.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement
customer_reviews.text: Great replacement ladder for our toyhauler! Seems strong so far. Will keep posted of anything changes as season to use trailer is over.
customer_reviews.author: Ladytray

customer_reviews.title: You will probably need to cut it
customer_reviews.text: Worked out great for our trailer. I did need to cut about 6 inches off the bottom to get it right so we could open the bathroom door.
customer_reviews.author: eric

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Works well in the rv. Make sure to follow directions and cut ro the proper length if needed. Id you do it supports full grown adults with ease.
customer_reviews.author: William B.

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed for our cab over bunk in the motorhome.
customer_reviews.text: Well made. Had to shorten it, but it fits our needs. The steps are a bit hard, so we covered them with foam.
customer_reviews.author: ism

customer_reviews.title: a little disappointment
customer_reviews.text: we put in our toy hauler for top bunk, it will work but not as sturdy as I had hoped
customer_reviews.author: patti

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this garbage
customer_reviews.text: I am disappointed how this item was received. It was pulled directly off the amazon truck this way and bent! This ladder is suppose to be sturdy and clearly it’s easy to bend. I would not recommend this product to anyone or this vendor
customer_reviews.author: Justin Smith

customer_reviews.title: LOOKS USED
customer_reviews.text: The product looks completely used. The metal across the ladder is scratched. This is and RV ladder.
customer_reviews.author: PRISCILLA

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for a keystone outback!
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly what we were looking for it fits perfectly in our travel trailer bunkhouse and is easily moved to either top bunk. We will be ordering another one in the near future and probably one as a backup in case something ends up happening to one. Overall this was a great purchase and I will definitely be purchasing at least 1 more.
customer_reviews.author: Wahmof4

customer_reviews.title: Verry  easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: This ladder was light, ease of mobility , and sturdy. I like the many options to secure the ladder to the top bunk bed. This ladder is being used in our camping trailer.
customer_reviews.author: William Petrino

customer_reviews.title: Ladder hooks do not fit into wall attachment.
customer_reviews.text: The ladder itself is fine, but the brackets at the hooks at the top of the ladder do not fit into the wall attachment pieces. The hooks are about 1/8 wider than the slot on the wall attachment. Makes this useless for me. Will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: Karla Trettel

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight feels good on feet
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight feels good on feet. Steel step ladder that came with RV hurt the feet as there was no padding and was heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Grayhawk51

customer_reviews.title: Works safely for young child
customer_reviews.text: Works great for 5 year old to get up and down bunk in camper. However my husband did have to saw it off a bit so it wouldn't take up so much room and sit more vertical against the bed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Seems like it may bend walking up
customer_reviews.text: The poles part of ladder could be a little thicker. Seems like it may bend walking up. I just received it so haven't had a chance to really use yet. Hopefully it stands the weight going up it.
customer_reviews.author: barbara j. martin

product_meta.title: Stromberg Carlson LA-460 60" Bunk Ladder
product_meta.description: Bunk ladders provide small feet easier access to their beds or larger feet easier access to stored materials. Bunk ladders come with rubber tread covers to provide comfort to bare feet. Multiple attachment methods are included with both size ladders for your convenience: either use the small hook and extrusion for a positive attachment or the larger hook so no facial board needs to be drilled. Choose from 66" tall or 60" tall for your convenience. Ladders can be trimmed for shorter bunk
feature_bullets: Bunk ladder includes padded rubber treads, and two styles of attachment for safety (hooks and extrusions)
Bunk ladder includes padded rubber treads, and two styles of attachment for safety (hooks and extrusions)
Stromberg Carlson Bunk Ladder, 60 inch , 1inch diameter ladder tubing , 11inch on center spacing between ladder uprights
